snippet: The United States and Afghanistan are struggling to reach a deal over the role American forces will play beyond next year, officials say, raising the possibility of total withdrawal.
abstract: Officials say that United States and Afghanistan have reached impasse in their talks over role that American forces will play there after 2014, raising the possibility of total withdrawal, outcome that Pentagon’s top military commanders previously dismissed.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt, Thom Shanker and Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The United States and Afghanistan are struggling to reach a deal over the role American forces will play beyond next year, officials say, raising the possibility of total withdrawal.

headline.main: Impasse With Afghanistan Raises Prospect of Total U.S. Withdrawal in 2014
headline.print_headline: Impasse With Afghanistan Raises Prospect of Total U.S. Withdrawal in 2014

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
